field.comment: A structural code, usually in case of error
field.name: code

field.comment: Broader correlation id that typically tracks thread execution.
field.name: correlationId

field.comment: Unique id for this particular service run instance. In case actions are logged in multiple processes we can link them via this.
field.name: runInstanceId

field.comment: The state of the action, RUNNING, ERROR, FAILED, SUCCEEDED,... (created is for async tasks etc)
field.name: processState

field.comment: The server that owns this action, it is also responsible for setting it to FAILED in case of server crash
field.name: serverOwner

field.comment: We can optionally capture input of say a service for reprocessing.
field.name: input

field.comment: A runtime description based on the definition
field.name: description

field.comment: The reason for execution. Usually this is just flow, but it could also be "migration"
field.name: reason

field.comment: If run via task framework, we keep the task id here
field.name: taskId

field.comment: Whether or not this was forced
field.name: forced

field.comment: Caused by a particular process action instance (usually a signal!)
field.name: triggerActionInstanceId
